unnormalised: The Great Indian Post Office Caper: Lost in Translation?
normalised: The Great Indian Post Office Caper: Lost in Translation?

unnormalised: It seems even the mighty bureaucracy isn't immune to a good old-fashioned address snafu! Sources tell us that the Department of Somewhat-Organized Affairs (yes, that's a real department, probably) at 7 Lok Kalyan Marg, New Delhi, 110001, has been struggling to receive its chai deliveries.
normalised: It seems even the mighty bureaucracy isn't immune to a good old-fashioned address snafu! Sources tell us that the Department of Somewhat-Organized Affairs (yes, that's a real department, probably) at seven Lok Kalyan Marg, New Delhi, one hundred and ten thousand and one, has been struggling to receive its chai deliveries.

unnormalised: The issue? Apparently, the delivery guy, Raju, a man who knows his way around a samosa more than a spreadsheet, keeps ending up at 7, Lok Nayak Bhawan, Khan Market, ND, 110003. A slight difference, you might think, but enough to confuse even Google Maps!
normalised: The issue? Apparently, the delivery guy, Raju, a man who knows his way around a samosa more than a spreadsheet, keeps ending up at seven, Lok Nayak Bhawan, Khan Market, N-D, one hundred and ten thousand and three. A slight difference, you might think, but enough to confuse even Google Maps!

unnormalised: "It's all these 'Lok' places, you see," Raju lamented, wiping sweat from his brow. "Lok Kalyan, Lok Nayak...it's like they're trying to confuse a poor chap!" He further added that trying to decipher handwritten addresses from the government employees was another hurdle altogether. He's contemplating investing in a magnifying glass and a degree in calligraphy.
normalised: "It's all these 'Lok' places, you see," Raju lamented, wiping sweat from his brow. "Lok Kalyan, Lok Nayak...it's like they're trying to confuse a poor chap!" He further added that trying to decipher handwritten addresses from the government employees was another hurdle altogether. He's contemplating investing in a magnifying glass and a degree in calligraphy.

unnormalised: The situation escalated when the Minister of Extremely Important Things (another likely department) Mr. Sharma, threw his weight into the mix, issuing a sternly worded letter from his office at 10 Janpath, New Delhi, 110011, demanding “immediate and comprehensive clarification.”
normalised: The situation escalated when the Minister of Extremely Important Things (another likely department) Mister Sharma, threw his weight into the mix, issuing a sternly worded letter from his office at ten Janpath, New Delhi, one hundred and ten thousand and eleven, demanding “immediate and comprehensive clarification.”

unnormalised: The letter, addressed to "The Head Honcho of Addressing Addresses," (we're making these up, but you get the point) at Dak Bhavan, Sansad Marg, New Delhi, 110001, was, ironically, delivered to the wrong address initially. The Head Honcho, a Mr. Iyer, apparently found it stuck to his windshield at a golf course 5 km away.
normalised: The letter, addressed to "The Head Honcho of Addressing Addresses," (we're making these up, but you get the point) at Dak Bhavan, Sansad Marg, New Delhi, one hundred and ten thousand and one, was, ironically, delivered to the wrong address initially. The Head Honcho, a Mister Iyer, apparently found it stuck to his windshield at a golf course five kilometer away.

unnormalised: The solution? A proposal to rename all government buildings to something utterly unforgettable, like "Building McBuildingface" or "The Place Where Paperwork Goes to Die." Until then, let’s hope Raju can find his way. After all, a nation runs on chai, especially one housed in addresses as elusive as a Bollywood plot twist! And maybe someone should send Mr. Sharma some calming chamomile tea. Perhaps deliver it via carrier pigeon, just to be safe.
normalised: The solution? A proposal to rename all government buildings to something utterly unforgettable, like "Building McBuildingface" or "The Place Where Paperwork Goes to Die." Until then, let’s hope Raju can find his way. After all, a nation runs on chai, especially one housed in addresses as elusive as a Bollywood plot twist! And maybe someone should send Mister Sharma some calming chamomile tea. Perhaps deliver it via carrier pigeon, just to be safe.

unnormalised: This entire situation is being investigated by the "Committee to Investigate Hilarious Bureaucratic Faux Pas," which, naturally, has its office at… you guessed it, a different address entirely. Good luck finding them!
normalised: This entire situation is being investigated by the "Committee to Investigate Hilarious Bureaucratic Faux Pas," which, naturally, has its office at… you guessed it, a different address entirely. Good luck finding them!
